home.name: Zhu Liang
home.title: Interdisciplinary Engineer & Designer
home.bio: Welcome to my ePortfolio. I am an engineer and designer with an interdisciplinary background, focusing on applying design thinking to complex system development. My deep background in e-governance, applied psychology, geographic information science, and digital twins enables me to integrate multidisciplinary knowledge and methods in projects.
home.highlight: As a student in the Red Bird MPhil program at HKUST(GZ), I have achieved significant growth in interdisciplinary innovation. The unique curriculum and practical opportunities of this program have enabled me to integrate knowledge from engineering, design, and computer science, fostering my ability to solve complex problems.

list.title: Web-based Psychological Support WeChat Mini Program Platform
list.description: A WeChat Mini Program platform for psychological support based on web cloud services, combining knowledge of e-governance, psychology, and computer science to implement psychological counseling, psychological testing, and psychological knowledge sharing functions.

list.title: UE4-based Independent Educational Reform Project - College Student Entrepreneurship Virtual Simulation Platform
list.description: An independently developed educational reform project using UE4, focusing on college students' entrepreneurial needs, combining e-governance expertise with virtual simulation technology. Independently designed interface, developed features, and completed the project.

list.title: BNU Compass - Campus Navigation
list.description: A web-based campus navigation system for Beijing Normal University, based on geographic information science and e-governance expertise. Focuses on solving campus navigation challenges with features including campus mapping, route planning, and location search.

list.title: UE5-based Danxiashan Outdoor Geography Field Study Educational Reform Project
list.description: An educational reform project implemented in UE5 for outdoor geography field studies at Danxiashan, integrating knowledge of geographic information science, applied psychology, and computer science, with modules covering vegetation, soil, geology, hydrology, and more.
